Click Events - Change Color

Click Me!

Here we have a simple function that checks the current background color when the box is clicked. If the current color is red, it changes it to blue. Otherwise, it changes it to red.

Use - document.getElementById - to select the element that will be used to trigger the event.

Use - .addEventListener() - to describe which type of event you want to 'listen' for.

Mouseover Events - Change Element's Position

Hover Over Me!

Once again we are using document.getElementById to target our example box, in this case box2. We use another event listener, this time listening for 'mouseover'. Once this happens, we set the position to absolute, and directly affect the 'left' attribute.

'Click' and 'mouseover' are just two examples of the many Javascript events that can take place. Here is an extensive list of Javascript events for reference, go crazy!

That was a bit jumpy though, wasn't it? Instead of moving over to the new location, the box just kinda 'jumps' there. In this next example, we'll take a look at how to smooth that out so the transition seems more natural.

Smooth Transitions

Hover Over Me!

That first example was a bit jumpy, but this one moves gradually to the new location. You'll also notice that I added in some functionality that allows the box to move back and forth as many times as you want.

The key to smooth transitions actually lies in the CSS. Add this bit of code to any element in CSS and any CSS changes will transition gradually over a 2 secone period. You can also put any amount of time that you want there, it doesn't have to be 2 seconds!

Change Content

This content changes

Type a few words into the input box, then hit submit!

We target the elements with document.getElementById, then we wait for the submit button to be clicked. Once it is, we set the inner text of the target div to the value of whatever is currently in the input box. We could also add some code to zero out the input box if we wanted: input.value = "" i.e. set it equal to an empty string!
